macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Indices Rally 1.2% on Tariff Tensions Easing
items.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 1.2% to 49,077.23, S&P 500 gained 1.2% to 6,875.62, and Nasdaq Composite added 1.2% to 23,224.82, driven by improved risk appetite following President Trump's announcement to suspend tariffs on European countries after reaching a framework agreement over Greenland.

items.title: Trump Suspends European Tariffs, Boosting Market Sentiment
items.summary: President Trump announced suspension of planned tariffs on European countries following a framework agreement over Greenland reached after meeting with NATO Secretary General, lifting market sentiment and supporting broad equity gains.

items.title: Small Caps Lead Rebound with Russell 2000 Up 2.0%
items.summary: The Russell 2000 small-cap index surged 2.0% to 2,698.17, outpacing broader market gains as risk appetite improved following the tariff announcement.

items.title: Halliburton Jumps 4.1% on Earnings Beat
items.summary: Halliburton shares surged 4.1% following better-than-expected earnings results.

items.title: United Airlines Rises 2.2% on Strong Guidance
items.summary: United Airlines gained 2.2% after reporting earnings and 2026 guidance that topped forecasts.

items.title: Netflix Falls 2.2% on Softer Margin Guidance
items.summary: Netflix declined 2.2% as investors weighed softer margin guidance and the company's Warner bid.

items.title: Mega-Cap Tech Stocks Show Strength in Premarket Trading
items.summary: Nvidia, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, Meta, Alphabet, Broadcom, and Tesla all advanced in premarket trading, supported by AI-related optimism including Alibaba's planned chipmaking unit listing and Nvidia CEO commentary.

items.title: Burberry Rises 5.0% on Holiday Sales Beat
items.summary: Burberry shares gained 5.0% after beating holiday sales expectations.

items.title: Rio Tinto Gains 5.2% on Strong Quarterly Production
items.summary: Rio Tinto advanced 5.2% following strong quarterly production results.

items.title: Asian Markets Mixed; Hang Seng Up 0.4%, Nikkei Down 0.4%
items.summary: Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index rose 0.4% to 26,585.06 and South Korea's Kospi added 0.5%, while Japan's Nikkei 225 slipped 0.4% to 52,774.64 and Australia's ASX 200 fell 0.4% to 8,782.90.

items.title: US Futures Point to Further Gains; PCE and GDP Data Due
items.summary: S&P 500 futures were up 0.6%, Nasdaq 100 adding 0.9%, and Dow Jones futures rising about 180 points. Traders are focused on PCE inflation data for October and November, as well as updated GDP growth estimates.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Crypto Market Cap Rises 1.5% to $3.13 Trillion Amid Reversal in Top Coins
items.summary: The cryptocurrency market capitalization increased by 1.5% over the past 24 hours to $3.13 trillion, with 87 of the top 100 coins appreciating and all top 10 coins reversing upward. Bitcoin rose 0.7% to $89,853, Ethereum gained 0.7% to $2,986, while Canton led with 12.2% to $0.1492.

items.title: Bitcoin Faces Bearish Technical Outlook with Potential Decline to $78,505
items.summary: Bitcoin is trading at around $87,940-$89,853 within a downward trend and descending channel, with moving averages indicating short-term bearish pressure. Forecasts predict a test of resistance near $92,505 followed by a decline targeting below $78,505, though bears hold the technical advantage.

items.title: Bitcoin Bears Maintain Technical Advantage on Daily Chart
items.summary: February bitcoin futures are near steady, but bears have the overall near-term technical edge according to daily chart analysis by veteran analyst Jim Wyckoff.

items.title: US Senate Agriculture Committee Advances Crypto Market Structure Bill
items.summary: The US Senate Agriculture Committee released updated crypto market structure legislation and scheduled a markup for January 27, though it lacks Democratic support.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: PhaseV Showcases AI-Driven Site Selection for IBD Clinical Trials
items.summary: PhaseV presented at the 2026 Crohn's & Colitis Congress how causal machine learning and IBD Plexus data optimize trial site selection and execution, reducing recruitment uncertainty and accelerating IBD studies in collaboration with the Crohn's & Colitis Foundation.

items.title: Agentiiv Partners with Vector Institute for Advanced Agentic AI
items.summary: Agentiiv announced a strategic technology partnership with the Vector Institute to develop enterprise-grade agentic AI systems that scale human expertise, targeting regulated industries with research-backed capabilities.

items.title: Thomson Reuters Deploys Agentic AI to Over 200 Law Schools
items.summary: Thomson Reuters is providing access to its professional-grade CoCounsel Legal and Westlaw Deep Research AI tools to more than 120,000 law students across 200+ US law schools to prepare them for AI-enabled legal practice.

items.title: Seneca Polytechnic Expands AI Collaboration with Microsoft
items.summary: Seneca Polytechnic and Microsoft are deepening their partnership to integrate AI innovations like Microsoft Foundry into education, equipping students with skills for an AI-driven economy amid Canada's rising AI adoption.

items.title: New Technique Enables Self-Improving AI Without External Supervision
items.summary: Researchers introduced a method allowing AI systems to enhance performance through usage on the same data without additional supervision, promising smarter AI development.

items.title: ZenaTech Completes 20th Acquisition in Drone-as-a-Service Expansion
items.summary: Vancouver-based ZenaTech finalized its 20th acquisition within the first year of launching Drone-as-a-Service, strengthening its AI-powered drone technology portfolio.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Ubisoft Stock Plummets 36% on Worst Day Ever Following Game Cancellations
items.summary: Ubisoft Entertainment's stock fell to its worst day since its 1996 IPO after the company cancelled six video games in development, including a Prince of Persia remake, and issued a dire profit warning. The company now forecasts EUR1.5 billion in net bookings, representing a 20% cut, and expects to lose about EUR1 billion on an adjusted basis this fiscal year.

items.title: Starbreeze Studios Announces New Wave of Layoffs
items.summary: Starbreeze Studios, developer of Payday 3, has issued a second round of layoffs following organizational changes after the game underperformed.

items.title: Milestone Releases Game Modes Trailer for Screamer
items.summary: Milestone released a new trailer for Screamer showcasing the game's various modes, following an earlier lore reveal.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Tiger Global and Microsoft to Fully Exit Walmart-Backed PhonePe via Upcoming IPO
items.summary: Tiger Global and Microsoft plan to sell their entire stakes in Indian payments startup PhonePe through its updated IPO filing, which targets a $15 billion valuation and could raise up to $1.5 billion. Walmart will retain its majority stake while selling about 9% of the company.

items.title: Chip Stocks Rally on Greenland Pivot and Tech Sector Boost
items.summary: Global stocks, particularly chip and tech sectors, gained in a relief rally following President Trump's pivot on Greenland and reduced tariff threats to Europe. The rally continued in Asia amid positive market sentiment.
